intro: Triodia pungens f. microstachya, commonly known as the fine-stemmed spinifex grass, is a perennial grass native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that are typically less than 2 cm in length. The plant produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with poor soil conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland dune systems. Its foliage is covered in fine, hair-like structures that help reduce water loss and protect against intense sunlight.
